Ferad,

There is definitely either a problem with your configuration, or the way 
that Eclipse is parsing it.  I'm close to asking what version of Eclipse 
you're using, the contents of your plugin.xml file, etc., but this isn't 
the mailing list for such questions.  I recommend posting the question 
over at

news://news.eclipse.org/eclipse.tools.jdt

Thanks,

    David Saff

Ferad Zyulkyarov wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I am trying to write a JUnit Test Plug-in for another Eclipse plugin
> that is a view part. What the test plug-in has to do is to open a new
> wrokbench, show the view, do some comparisons regarding the contents
> of the view and hide the view. The problem that I experience is that
> the JUnit TestCase does not lunch because the JUnit plugin can not be
> located (loaded). I want to note that I did included the JUnit plugin
> as a dependency plugin for the JUnit Test plugin.
>
> The error that is printed on the console is given below. I think this
> is not a big issue. Hope that your help will help me overcome it.
> Thanks a lot for your help.
>
> Exception in thread "Thread-1" org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to
> execute runnable (java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
> junit/framework/TestCase)
>       at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2691)
>       at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2616)
>       at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.syncExec(
> Synchronizer.java:161)
>       at
> org.eclipse.ui.internal.UISynchronizer.syncExec(UI
> Synchronizer.java:25)
>       at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.syncExec(Display.java:3022)
>       at
> org.eclipse.ui.internal.testing.WorkbenchTestable.
> runTest(WorkbenchTestable.java:83)
>       at
> org.eclipse.pde.internal.junit.runtime.UITestAppli
> cation.runTests(UITestApplication.java:90)
>       at
> org.eclipse.ui.internal.testing.WorkbenchTestable$
> 1.run(WorkbenchTestable.java:56)
>       at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
> Unhandled event loop exception
> Reason:
> Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
> junit/framework/TestCase)
> *** SWT nested exception
> Reason:
> junit/framework/TestCase
>
